page.title: 15 GREYHOUND RACING
page.content: The popular Portsmouth stadium near the Mountbatten Centre has regular races,even in the holidays.Racing starts at 11am. with 10 races with 15 minutes intervals between each one.Each greyhound starts the race in a trap. A hare (fake) is sent round the track and when the traps open the greyhounds follow.The winner crosses the finish line first.It costs Â£1.00 to watch the races in the open air and Â£2.00 to watch from the bar. People bet on greyhounds,and after each race the results are put up on a screen. Greyhound racing is fun to watch and doesn't cost much for an enjoyable day out.Built in 1931,the stadium seats 1,500,has a 380 metre track and the best greyhound ever was Hey There Merry(1960-62).
